verses:
A psalm for David.  The Lord said to my Lord:  Sit thou at my
right hand:  Until I make thy enemies thy footstool.

The Lord will send forth the sceptre of thy power out of Sion:
rule thou in the midst of thy enemies.

With thee is the principality in the day of thy strength:  in the
brightness of the saints:  from the womb before the day star I begot
thee.

The Lord hath sworn, and he will not repent:  Thou art a priest
for ever according to the order of Melchisedech.

The Lord at thy right hand hath broken kings in the day of his
wrath.

He shall judge among nations, he shall fill ruins:  he shall
crush the heads in the land of many.

He shall drink of the torrent in the way:  therefore shall he
lift up the head.
